post.author: printz
post.body:
I played Prey and the part where you go through a portal onto a small stone sphere, and you get shrunk, and gravity gets adjusted for you over that "planet", blew my mind.

Is it an integral part of Prey's engine, or a one-time deal based on mapping hacks? I'd love if I can see more of it in custom missions (I've played Prey for awhile until I got tired, and I only encountered such a thing once).

post.author: BloodRayne
post.body:
printz wrote:
I played Prey and the part where you go through a portal onto a small stone sphere, and you get shrunk, and gravity gets adjusted for you over that "planet", blew my mind.

Is it an integral part of Prey's engine, or a one-time deal based on mapping hacks? I'd love if I can see more of it in custom missions (I've played Prey for awhile until I got tired, and I only encountered such a thing once).

I think it's just a really large map but I'm not sure at all.

post.author: Neurological
post.body: Yeah you actually don't get shrunk, but you go on another room, the giant stuff outside is a trick, basicly it use a portalsky to render the room as 3d skybox that enlarge it 16x time, but is only a visual effect it doesn't get bigger for real, you can noclip in the map to see the trick.

post.author: NX-317
post.body:
Yes, the shrinking is just a portal sky. Very breathtaking, nevertheless. And the planetary gravity is a part of the engine, you can learn more here.

printz wrote:
I'd love if I can see more of it in custom missions


Try my map, it has a similar scene, and I did more action than in the original.
